author: learn-build-service-prod[bot]
message:
Merge pull request #10122 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-10-23 22:05 UTC

ai_summary.Messages:
{"role":"user","content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: [
  {
    "sha": "d516f493f6bf6cafa8317a1a14852c494997e2c5",
    "filename": "docs/architecture/recover-from-deletions.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 4,
    "deletions": 1,
    "changes": 5,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/2640d97c6bb5ac19f1cb4833016e9e327ea1ea7c/docs%2Farchitecture%2Frecover-from-deletions.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/2640d97c6bb5ac19f1cb4833016e9e327ea1ea7c/docs%2Farchitecture%2Frecover-from-deletions.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Farchitecture%2Frecover-from-deletions.md?ref=2640d97c6bb5ac19f1cb4833016e9e327ea1ea7c",
    "patch": "@@ -193,6 +193,9 @@ Moving from soft to hard delete:\n * A soft-deleted object isn't restored within 30 days.\n * An administrator intentionally deletes an object in the soft delete state.\n \n+>[!Note]\n+> Application objects are not hard deleted automatically even after 30 days when ‘signInAudience’ value of the apps are set to one of (\"AzureADMultipleOrgs\", \"AzureADandPersonalMicrosoftAccount\", or \"PersonalMicrosoftAccount\"). In this case, application objects should be manually hard deleted.\n+\n Directly hard deleted:\n \n * The object type that was deleted doesn't support soft delete.\n@@ -214,4 +217,4 @@ Make sure you have a process to regularly review items in the soft-delete state\n \n ## Next steps\n \n-Learn how to avoid unwanted deletions in, [Recoverability best practices](recoverability-overview.md).\n\\ No newline at end of file\n+Learn how to avoid unwanted deletions in, [Recoverability best practices](recoverability-overview.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "ce3db5ef06ea6752927fbfa57a85912f39b80c72",
    "filename": "docs/global-secure-access/how-to-install-windows-client.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 90,
    "deletions": 81,
    "changes": 171,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/2640d97c6bb5ac19f1cb4833016e9e327ea1ea7c/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-install-windows-client.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/2640d97c6bb5ac19f1cb4833016e9e327ea1ea7c/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-install-windows-client.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-install-windows-client.md?ref=2640d97c6bb5ac19f1cb4833016e9e327ea1ea7c",
    "patch": "@@ -70,88 +70,97 @@ Package the installation script into a `.intunewin` file.\n   <summary>PowerShell installation script</summary>\n \n ```powershell\n-# Define log file\n-\n-$logFile = \"$env:ProgramData\\GSAInstall\\install.log\" New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $logFile) -Force | Out-Null \n-\n-function Write-Log { param ([string]$message) $timestamp = Get-Date -Format \"yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss\" Add-Content -Path $logFile -Value \"$timestamp - $message\" } \n-\n-try { $ErrorActionPreference = 'Stop' Write-Log \"Starting Global Secure Access client installation.\" \n-\n-# IPv4 preferred via DisabledComponents registry value \n-$ipv4RegPath   = \"HKLM:\\SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Services\\Tcpip6\\Parameters\" \n-$ipv4RegName   = \"DisabledComponents\" \n-$ipv4RegValue  = 0x20   # Prefer IPv4 over IPv6 \n-$rebootRequired = $false \n- \n-# Ensure the key exists \n-if (-not (Test-Path $ipv4RegPath)) { \n-    New-Item -Path $ipv4RegPath -Force | Out-Null \n-    Write-Log \"Created registry key: $ipv4RegPath\" \n-} \n- \n-# Get current value if present \n-$existingValue = $null \n-$valueExists = $false \n-try { \n-    $existingValue = Get-ItemPropertyValue -Path $ipv4RegPath -Name $ipv4RegName -ErrorAction Stop \n-    $valueExists = $true \n-} catch { \n-    $valueExists = $false \n-} \n- \n-# Determine if we must change it \n-$expected = [int]$ipv4RegValue \n-$needsChange = -not $valueExists -or ([int]$existingValue -ne $expected) \n- \n-if ($needsChange) { \n-    if (-not $valueExists) { \n-        # Create as DWORD when missing \n-        New-ItemProperty -Path $ipv4RegPath -Name $ipv4RegName -PropertyType DWord -Value $expected -Force | Out-Null \n-        Write-Log \"IPv4Preferred value missing. Created '$ipv4RegName' with value 0x{0} (dec {1}).\" -f ([Convert]::ToString($expected,16)), $expected \n-    } else { \n-        # Update if different \n-        Set-ItemProperty -Path $ipv4RegPath -Name $ipv4RegName -Value $expected \n-        Write-Log (\"IPv4Preferred value differed. Updated '{0}' from 0x{1} (dec {2}) to 0x{3} (dec {4}).\" -f ` \n-            $ipv4RegName, ([Convert]::ToString([int]$existingValue,16)), [int]$existingValue, ([Convert]::ToString($expected,16)), $expected) \n-    } \n-    $rebootRequired = $true \n-} else { \n-    Write-Log (\"IPv4Preferred already set correctly: {0}=0x{1} (dec {2}). No change.\" -f ` \n-        $ipv4RegName, ([Convert]::ToString($expected,16)), $expected) \n-} \n- \n-# Run installer from local path \n-$installerPath = Join-Path -Path $PSScriptRoot -ChildPath \"GlobalSecureAccessClient.exe\" \n-Write-Log \"Running installer from $installerPath\" \n- \n-if (Test-Path $installerPath) { \n-    $installProcess = Start-Process -FilePath $installerPath -ArgumentList \"/quiet\" -Wait -PassThru \n- \n-    if ($installProcess.ExitCode -eq 1618) { \n-        Write-Log \"Another installation is in progress. Exiting with code 1618.\" \n-        exit 1618 \n-    } elseif ($installProcess.ExitCode -ne 0) { \n-        Write-Log \"Installer exited with code $($installProcess.ExitCode).\" \n-        exit $installProcess.ExitCode \n-    } \n- \n-    Write-Log \"Installer completed successfully.\" \n-} else { \n-    Write-Log \"Installer not found at $installerPath\" \n-    exit 1 \n-} \n- \n-if ($rebootRequired) { \n-    Write-Log \"Reboot required due to registry value creation or update.\" \n-    exit 3010  # Soft reboot required \n-} else { \n-    Write-Log \"Installation complete. No reboot required.\" \n-    exit 0 \n-} \n-  \n+# Create log directory and log helper\n+$logFile = \"$env:ProgramData\\GSAInstall\\install.log\"\n+New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $logFile) -Force | Out-Null\n+\n+function Write-Log {\n+    param([string]$message)\n+    $timestamp = Get-Date -Format \"yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss\"\n+    Add-Content -Path $logFile -Value \"$timestamp - $message\"\n+}\n \n-} catch { Write-Log \"Fatal error: $_\" exit 1603 } \n+try {\n+    $ErrorActionPreference = 'Stop'\n+    Write-Log \"Starting Global Secure Access client installation.\"\n+\n+    # IPv4 preferred via DisabledComponents registry value\n+    $ipv4RegPath    = \"HKLM:\\SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Services\\Tcpip6\\Parameters\"\n+    $ipv4RegName    = \"DisabledComponents\"\n+    $ipv4RegValue   = 0x20  # Prefer IPv4 over IPv6\n+    $rebootRequired = $false\n+\n+    # Ensure the key exists\n+    if (-not (Test-Path $ipv4RegPath)) {\n+        New-Item -Path $ipv4RegPath -Force | Out-Null\n+        Write-Log \"Created registry key: $ipv4RegPath\"\n+    }\n+\n+    # Get current value if present\n+    $existingValue = $null\n+    $valueExists = $false\n+    try {\n+        $existingValue = Get-ItemPropertyValue -Path $ipv4RegPath -Name $ipv4RegName -ErrorAction Stop\n+        $valueExists = $true\n+    } catch {\n+        $valueExists = $false\n+    }\n+\n+    # Determine if we must change it\n+    $expected = [int]$ipv4RegValue\n+    $needsChange = -not $valueExists -or ([int]$existingValue -ne $expected)\n+\n+    if ($needsChange) {\n+        if (-not $valueExists) {\n+            # Create as DWORD when missing\n+            New-ItemProperty -Path $ipv4RegPath -Name $ipv4RegName -PropertyType DWord -Value $expected -Force | Out-Null\n+            Write-Log (\"IPv4Preferred value missing. Created '{0}' with value 0x{1} (dec {2}).\" -f $ipv4RegName, ([Convert]::ToString($expected,16)), $expected)\n+        } else {\n+            # Update if different\n+            Set-ItemProperty -Path $ipv4RegPath -Name $ipv4RegName -Value $expected\n+            Write-Log (\"IPv4Preferred value differed. Updated '{0}' from 0x{1} (dec {2}) to 0x{3} (dec {4}).\" -f `\n+                $ipv4RegName, ([Convert]::ToString([int]$existingValue,16)), [int]$existingValue, ([Convert]::ToString($expected,16)), $expected)\n+        }\n+        $rebootRequired = $true\n+    } else {\n+        Write-Log (\"IPv4Preferred already set correctly: {0}=0x{1} (dec {2}). No change.\" -f `\n+            $ipv4RegName, ([Convert]::ToString($expected,16)), $expected)\n+    }\n+\n+    # Resolve installer path\n+    $ScriptRoot = if ($PSScriptRoot) { $PSScriptRoot } else { Split-Path -Parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Path }\n+    $installerPath = Join-Path -Path $ScriptRoot -ChildPath \"GlobalSecureAccessClient.exe\"\n+    Write-Log \"Running installer from $installerPath\"\n+\n+    if (Test-Path $installerPath) {\n+        $installProcess = Start-Process -FilePath $installerPath -ArgumentList \"/quiet\" -Wait -PassThru\n+\n+        if ($installProcess.ExitCode -eq 1618) {\n+            Write-Log \"Another installation is in progress. Exiting with code 1618.\"\n+            exit 1618\n+        } elseif ($installProcess.ExitCode -ne 0) {\n+            Write-Log \"Installer exited with code $($installProcess.ExitCode).\"\n+            exit $installProcess.ExitCode\n+        }\n+\n+        Write-Log \"Installer completed successfully.\"\n+    } else {\n+        Write-Log \"Installer not found at $installerPath\"\n+        exit 1\n+    }\n+\n+    if ($rebootRequired) {\n+        Write-Log \"Reboot required due to registry value creation or update.\"\n+        exit 3010  # Soft reboot required\n+    } else {\n+        Write-Log \"Installation complete. No reboot required.\"\n+        exit 0\n+    }\n+}\n+catch {\n+    Write-Log \"Fatal error: $_\"\n+    exit 1603\n+}\n ```\n \n </details>"
  },

    "patch": "@@ -173,16 +173,14 @@ items:\n     items:\n       - name: Understand Internet Access\n         href: concept-internet-access.md\n-      - name: Configure web content filtering\n-        href: how-to-configure-web-content-filtering.md\n-      - name: Check URL category\n-        href: how-to-check-web-content-filtering-categories.md\n       - name: What is Transport Layer Security inspection? \n         href: concept-transport-layer-security.md \n       - name: Configure Transport Layer Security inspection \n         href: how-to-transport-layer-security.md \n       - name: Configure web content filtering\n         href: how-to-configure-web-content-filtering.md\n+      - name: Check URL category\n+        href: how-to-check-web-content-filtering-categories.md\n       - name: Configure threat intelligence\n         href: how-to-configure-threat-intelligence.md\n       - name: Customize the block page"
  },
  {
    "sha": "304d84b65a8919763f19bc3afc77e1881a16c8f7",
    "filename": "docs/verified-id/idv-partners.md",
    "status": "modified",

    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fverified-id%2Fidv-partners.md?ref=2640d97c6bb5ac19f1cb4833016e9e327ea1ea7c",
    "patch": "@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ ms.service: entra-verified-id\n author: barclayn\n manager: pmwongera\n ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 09/23/2025\n+ms.date: 10/14/2025\n ms.author: barclayn\n ---\n \n@@ -93,15 +93,19 @@ To test the user flow, you could always deploy one of the sample applications in\n \n The following table showcases the list of Verified ID  IDV partners. If you're an IDV partner seeking to get listed in this gallery, submit your solution details using the self-submission form: [https://aka.ms/VIDCertifiedPartnerForm](https://aka.ms/VIDCertifiedPartnerForm).\n \n-| **IDV partner** | **Description** |\n-|:-------------------------|:--------------|\n-|:::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/partner-gallery/au10tix.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of au10tix logo.\"::: | [AU10TIX](https://www.au10tix.com/solutions/verifiable-credentials/) improves Verifiability While Protecting Privacy For Businesses, Employees, Contractors, Vendors, And Customers. |\n-| :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/partner-gallery/lexisnexis.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of a LexisNexis logo.\"::: | [LexisNexis](https://solutions.risk.lexisnexis.com/did-microsoft) risk solutions Verifiable credentials enable faster onboarding for employees, students, citizens, or others to access services. |\n-| :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/partner-gallery/vu-logo.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of a Vu logo.\"::: | [Vu](https://www.vusecurity.com/es/products/digital-identity) verifiable credentials with just a selfie and your ID.|\n-| :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/partner-gallery/onfido.jpeg\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of an Onfido logo.\"::: | Start issuing and accepting verifiable credentials in minutes. With verifiable credentials and Onfido you can verify a person’s identity while respecting privacy. Digitally validate information on a person’s ID or their biometrics.|\n-| :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/partner-gallery/jumio.jpeg\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of a Jumio logo.\"::: | [Jumio](https://www.jumio.com/microsoft-verifiable-credentials/) is helping to support a new form of digital identity by Microsoft based on verifiable credentials and decentralized identifiers standards to let consumers verify once and use everywhere.|\n-| :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/partner-gallery/idemia.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of an Idemia logo.\"::: | [Idemia](https://na.idemia.com/identity/verifiable-credentials/) Integration with Verified ID enables “Verify once, use everywhere” functionality.|\n-| :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/partner-gallery/clear.jpeg\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of a Clear logo.\"::: | [Clear](https://ir.clearme.com/news-events/press-releases/detail/25/clear-collaborates-with-microsoft-to-create-more-secure) Collaborates with Microsoft to Create More Secure Digital Experience Through Verification Credential.|\n+| Partner | Partner documentation | Description |\n+|---------|----------------------|-------------|\n+| 1Kosmos | [1Kosmos deployment guide](https://aka.ms/1kosmosvidguide) | 1Kosmos and Microsoft Entra Verified ID unite to deliver trusted, privacy-preserving identity verification that empowers secure, passwordless access across ecosystems. |\n+| Au10tix | [Au10tix documentation](https://www.au10tix.com/solutions/verifiable-credentials/) | AU10TIX improves Verifiability While Protecting Privacy For Businesses, Employees, Contractors, Vendors, And Customers. |\n+| Clear | [Clear documentation](https://ir.clearme.com/news-events/press-releases/detail/25/clear-collaborates-with-microsoft-to-create-more-secure) | Clear Collaborates with Microsoft to Create More Secure Digital Experience Through Verification Credential. |\n+| ID Dataweb | [ID Dataweb deployment guide](https://aka.ms/iddatawebguide) | ID Dataweb offers secure and low friction identity verification processes to ensure the validity of your Microsoft Entra Verified ID credential. Easy to integrate, easy for your users, secure for your enterprise. |\n+| Idemia | [Idemia documentation](https://na.idemia.com/identity/verifiable-credentials/) | Idemia Integration with Microsoft Entra Verified ID enables \"Verify once, use everywhere\" functionality. |\n+| Jumio | [Jumio deployment guide](https://www.jumio.com/microsoft-verifiable-credentials/) | Jumio is helping to support a new form of digital identity by Microsoft based on verifiable credentials and decentralized identifiers standards to let consumers verify once and use everywhere. |\n+| LexisNexis | [LexisNexis documentation](https://solutions.risk.lexisnexis.com/did-microsoft) | LexisNexis risk solutions Verifiable credentials enable faster onboarding for employees, students, citizens, or others to access services. |\n+| Persona | [Persona deployment guide](https://aka.ms/personaguide) | Persona integrates with Microsoft Entra Verified ID to unlock identity verification processes, enabling trusted user-owned credentials and frictionless onboarding. |\n+| Transmit Security | [Transmit Security deployment guide](https://aka.ms/transmitsecurityguide) | Mosaic by Transmit Security integrates with Microsoft Entra Verified ID to deliver seamless, secure, and accurate identity verification through verifiable credentials. |\n+| Vu | [Vu documentation](https://www.vusecurity.com/es/products/digital-identity) | Vu verifiable credentials with just a selfie and your ID. |\n+| ZealID | [ZealID deployment guide](https://developer.zealid.com/docs/zealid-vc) | ZealID Verified Credential Wallet powered by Microsoft Entra Verified ID completes the full cycle of identification and signing for various workflows. |\n \n \n "
  }
]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response:
Here's a summary of the changes:

A note has been added to the "recover-from-deletions" documentation clarifying that application objects with specific `signInAudience` values are not automatically hard-deleted after 30 days and require manual deletion.

The installation script for the Windows client in the "global-secure-access" documentation has been updated, including improvements to logging and registry handling for IPv4 preference.

Minor adjustments have been made to the table of contents for "global-secure-access", reordering and adding a link for web content filtering categories.

The "verified-id/idv-partners.md" document has been updated to a new table format for listing Identity Verification (IDV) partners, including new partners and updated links to their respective documentation.

updating partner table

ai_summary.Response: This commit updates the Microsoft Entra Verified ID partner page. The `ms.date` metadata has been advanced to 14th October 2025. The main change is a significant restructuring and expansion of the IDV partner list, moving from a simple table of partners and descriptions to a more detailed table that includes partner names, links to their specific documentation, and a concise description of their service integration with Microsoft Entra Verified ID. Several new partners have also been added.

author: Taojunshen
message:
Merge pull request #10121 from MicrosoftDocs/repo_sync_working_branch

Confirm merge from repo_sync_working_branch to main to sync with https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs (branch main)

ai_summary.Messages:
{"role":"user","content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: {
  "sha": "d516f493f6bf6cafa8317a1a14852c494997e2c5",
  "filename": "docs/architecture/recover-from-deletions.md",
  "status": "modified",
  "additions": 4,
  "deletions": 1,
  "changes": 5,
  "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/19849103b32c8012749890bbacbddab480baecb7/docs%2Farchitecture%2Frecover-from-deletions.md",
  "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/19849103b32c8012749890bbacbddab480baecb7/docs%2Farchitecture%2Frecover-from-deletions.md",
  "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Farchitecture%2Frecover-from-deletions.md?ref=19849103b32c8012749890bbacbddab480baecb7",
  "patch": "@@ -193,6 +193,9 @@ Moving from soft to hard delete:\n * A soft-deleted object isn't restored within 30 days.\n * An administrator intentionally deletes an object in the soft delete state.\n \n+>[!Note]\n+> Application objects are not hard deleted automatically even after 30 days when ‘signInAudience’ value of the apps are set to one of (\"AzureADMultipleOrgs\", \"AzureADandPersonalMicrosoftAccount\", or \"PersonalMicrosoftAccount\"). In this case, application objects should be manually hard deleted.\n+\n Directly hard deleted:\n \n * The object type that was deleted doesn't support soft delete.\n@@ -214,4 +217,4 @@ Make sure you have a process to regularly review items in the soft-delete state\n \n ## Next steps\n \n-Learn how to avoid unwanted deletions in, [Recoverability best practices](recoverability-overview.md).\n\\ No newline at end of file\n+Learn how to avoid unwanted deletions in, [Recoverability best practices](recoverability-overview.md)."
}. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response: This commit to the entra-docs repository modifies the `recover-from-deletions.md` document. The changes clarify the process of hard deleting objects in Microsoft Entra ID. Specifically, a note has been added to highlight that application objects with certain `signInAudience` values will not be automatically hard deleted after 30 days and require manual intervention. The commit also removes a trailing newline character from the end of the file.
